definition: Liu Ji or Liu Bowen 劉伯溫|刘伯温 (1311-1375), general under the first Ming emperor Zhu Yuanzhang 朱元璋, with a reputation as a military genius
(classical) a type of battle-ax/to kill/to slaughter
surname Liu
base/foundation/basic/radical (chemistry)/(slang) gay

sentences.english: The year of poetry creation is the basic work of Liu Ji study.
sentences.chinese: 诗文系年是刘基研究的基础性工作。

definition: Liu Bowen (1311-1375), general under the first Ming emperor Zhu Yuanzhang 朱元璋, with a reputation as a military genius/also called Liu Ji 劉基|刘基

reign name of second Ming emperor, reigned 1398-1402, deposed in 1402

Hai Rui (1514-1587), Ming politician, famous for honesty and integrity

Wang Dun (266-324), powerful general of Jin dynasty and brother of civil official Wang Dao 王導|王导, subsequently rebellious warlord 322-324
Huang Zongxi (1610-1695), scholar and writer of the Ming-Qing transition
Qin Hui (1090-1155 AD), Song Dynasty official said to have betrayed General Yue Fei 岳飛|岳飞[Yue4 Fei1]
